name: Palm Court at The Plaza Hotel

reviews.title: Such Disappointing Service
reviews.text: I recently had a stay, my first, at the Plaza and I won't be hurrying back. The hotel in and of itself is resting on its laurels, I feel, but I specifically wanted to review the High Tea at the Palm Court. For $50 AND the reputation of the Plaza, you'd figure the staff would be falling all over themselves to tend to us but I actually had to find a waiter, to tell him to find MY waiter, to bring us more tea. Tea should have been endless and freely flowing but apparently that was too much to ask. The accompanying treats were fine, the tea was delicious, and the room quite grand although showing its age a bit (and the accompanying pianist was playing "Zombie" by the Cranberries, an odd choice) but the lack of attentiveness in a relatively small room that was half full was obvious and really, shameful. We were never asked how everything was, no water refill, just no check in. I am surprised it is allowed to continue, I would never be allowed to do my job that poorly. I would cut them slack if it was busy, and I'm not a restaurant snob but my waiter was just never in the room. But PS the men doing the bussing of the plates were personable and friendly.

reviews.title: A Wonderful Way to Spend an Afternoon with Friends
reviews.text: My girlfriends and I had Tea at 2:00pm on a Friday. It lasted a few hours and was fantastic. It costs $50 per person and you get all the tea you can drink plus a selection of tea sandwiches, a selection of scones and a selection on desserts. I never thought that I could get full from a "tea" but I did. They also have a very special Eloise Tea for the little ones with kid friendly tea sandwiches and desserts.

The Palm court at the Plaza is a perfect upscale brunch location in NYC. The hotel itself is luxurious, with great ambiance, rich history and classic decor. The service is exceptional and the menu is a creative blend between unique dishes and artistic original expressions of traditional brunch food.
reviews.title: Wonderful brunch place with great food and ambiance
A magical and luxurious afternoon
reviews.text: I recently enjoyed afternoon tea at the Plaza with my husband, father and two young daughters (aged 15 months and four). The experience was every bit as magical and leisurely as I hoped. The Palm Court is an exquisite space - elegant and sumptuous. There were plentiful delicious treats and savouries (I loved the scones), and the Plaza's signature tea was superb and served beautifully hot. My girls shared the delightful "Eloise" themed tea, which was inventive and perfectly appealing to children.

Service was excellent on the day we attended. My children were made to feel welcome, which I'm sure assisted them to rise to the occasion. A high chair was provided for my youngest. We felt unrushed and pampered. When we next make the trip across the world, we will definitely return.
reviews.title: Afternoon tea at the Palm Court
traditional elegence
reviews.text: What can you say....this is the epitomey of class and stature. Plush seating, beautiful tables, music in backround. Staff polite, and professional. Tea and meal choices are fun. We had a wonderful mother/daughter afternoon. And was a pleasure to be able to have quiet time, after just arriving in the city. Would do this adventure again.

Brunch at the Palm Court is a lovely affair worthy of your Sunday best. Sadly, there is no dress code, and several diners were seen with shorts and tee shirts. This elegant restaurant should be respected with nice dress for all.
reviews.title: Lovely, elegant atmosphere, food just OK

reviews.text: We had reservations and were seated promptly. Water was offered with a choice of tap water or bottled water (we chose tap water - the water in NYC is some of the best I've ever had.) We were offered coffee, tea, and/or drinks. Illy coffee is excellent, and offered with skim or whole milk or half and half. Drinks are pricey at $21 for a bloody Mary with a jumbo shrimp in a Tom Collins glass (tall thin glass - I would guess with ice, it's probably about a 6 oz drink). Other drinks are similarly priced. A bread basket is offered with a variety of fruit breads, which are very good, and included a dinner-sized crusty roll that was tough and impossible to chew. It was the only non-sweet bread offered.
reviews.title: A magnificent failure!
Good, not great.
reviews.text: Three in our party had brunch, and one ordered steak off the menu. The menu is limited, but varied and interesting. The steak was a huge hit, cooked perfectly and served with nice vegetables. The buffet included a nice selection of fresh fruit, scrambled eggs - nicely prepared for a buffet - bacon, potatoes, a cheese tray and pastries. Given that this is in NYC with some of the best bakeries in the world, the pastries were disappointing, and there were no crackers for the cheese, only the bread described above.

My biggest disappointment was that when those who ordered buffet went back for seconds, the plate was not cleared, nor was the napkin folded. To me, these are the hallmarks of a fine buffet, outside the food quality. Other than that, the service was excellent.
reviews.title: Expected more of the Plaza
royalty
reviews.text: I had Tea with a friend this past Sunday afternoon and it was a great experience. The renovations to the building are beautiful and the laylight is something you should see just by itself. We made reservations a few days in advance and it was a bit difficult to get a person on the phone to make the reservations

reviews.title: High Tea, Palm Court.
reviews.text: Visiting New York with wife and two friends, so decided on High Tea at the Palm Court, Plaza Hotel. Has been some 35 years since I had High Tea at the Plaza. Made a booking and arrived at 3pm as planned. Was greeted by a female member of staff (?maitre d) and taken to our table. Our waiter was rather off handed in his attitude towards us, quite disappointing really as we had made the effort to dress for the occasion (perhaps somewhat over dressed after looking at the dress standards of some of the other patrons).

reviews.title: Nothing Better.
reviews.text: The High Tea was totally delicious and thoroughly enjoyed by all of us. However, we were very disappointed with the standard of service and of the (lack of )standard of dress of the staff. One female staff member was wearing Joggers. Our waiter lacked the most basic skills expected for a Hotel of the standard of the Plaza. He was not attentive to our needs and was half hearted when asked to attend to our needs. Eg did not attend to refilling our water glasses,pouring the tea, or replacing used plates and cutlery. An issue the Management must address. The experience of High Tea at the Plaza was all that we expected however the service was vastly inferior to what was expected and delivered.

The atmosphere is the foundation for many, many finishing touches from the fine food to the elegant table to the bottomless pot of hot tea. The sevice is incredible and you are treated like the Queen that you feel like.
reviews.title: Rude and Rushed
sooo disappointed....stuck up rude waiter overcharged my card
reviews.text: Three friends and I recently had afternoon tea at the Palm Court. I had never had tea at the Plaza before, but because of its reputation, I was excited to enjoy a leisurely afternoon.
We had our wedding reception (okay.....there were only 4 of us!) here and it exceeded our expectations. It doesn't get any classier than this!!
reviews.title: Our Royal Reception!

reviews.text: We got married in New York recently and had afternoon tea at the Plaza in the afternoon. As soon as we arrived we were congratulated and offered a glass of champagne. The service was very good and pleasant and the food was good and very pretty looking. The Plaza itself is very beautiful and the experience is not all about the food or the champagne, it is very much about enjoying it all in those beautiful surroundings. I'd recommend especially for a special occasion.
reviews.title: Luxurious afternoon
amazing brunch at the Plaza
reviews.text: The plaza hotel needs no introduction with guests as famous as Marilyn Monroe or the Beatles its reputation of luxury and elegance in the heart of New York is no longer to be made.

reviews.title: Nice Room, But!
reviews.text: So I am not here to talk about the hotel but about the brunch, way more affordable than a room in the palace it will give you a taste of luxury.
Walk the red carpet of the main entrance, pass through the impressive reception, go allow in a gallery with portraits of all the famous guests and you will finally arrive to your table.
reviews.title: Lovely food and lovely staff
